title: Scotland and World Rugby on collision course over lack of contingency plan for possible fixture cancellation
text:
Furious Scotland are on a collision course with World Rugby as insiders warned that the integrity of the World Cup is at stake if their match against Japan is cancelled.

At present, their final pool A match against the hosts will go ahead on Sunday in Yokohama as Japan braces itself for Typhoon Hagibis, which is due to hit Tokyo on Saturday. An inspection will take place six hours before kick-off to determine whether the match can go ahead. After the World Rugby confirmed that there were no further contingency plans in place, a cancellation would result in the match being declared a 0-0 draw which would almost certainly eliminate Gregor Townsend’s side from the tournament.

description: Furious Scotland are on a collision course with World Rugby as insiders warned that the integrity of the World Cup is at stake if their match against Japan is cancelled.
